isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 11 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTO-1X707LL/DLL/MLL AND RTO-1X709MLL MODELS - ASSEMBLE - STANDARD SHIFTER HOUSING (1X709 MODELS)

svcproc.title: STANDARD SHIFTER HOUSING (1X709 MODELS)
svcproc.para: Inspect shift blocks and shift yokes for wear.

Apply Eaton sealant #71208 or Loctite 242 to the shifter housing plugs which are used to plug oil cooler provision holes. The sealant should be applied so that at least 5 complete threads are covered.

Apply Eaton lockwire #1819 or equivalent to all shifter housing assembly set screws in both blocks and yokes. The wire should anchor the setscrew at least 2 complete 360° turns. The lockwire ends should be trimmed and bent out of the way of any part interference.
Keep yoke bars in neutral while assembling.

step1.para: Assemble the yoke actuator assembly ( Figure 132 and Figure 133):

step2.para: Install actuator pin and yoke actuator from the shifter housing bottom.
Install the washer and nut on the shifter housing top. Tighten to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 N•m).

step1.para: Assemble the 1st & reverse shift yoke assembly ( Figure 134):

step2.para: Install plunger in 1st & reverse shift yoke bore, plunger shank to outside.
Install the spring into the bore over the plunger shank.
Install the plug and tighten to compress the spring.
After plug bottoms out, back the plug out 1 to 1-1/2 turns.
Complete the block assembly process by staking the plug through the small hole in block.

step1.para: With the housing rear to the right, lay the assembly on a flat surface ( Figure 135).
Start installation of bottom shift bar. As the bar passes the bosses, install the two (2) bottom shift yoke assemblies. Finish installation ( Figure 135).
Install the shift yoke lockscrew. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Lockwire securely ( Figure 136).
Place the actuating plunger in the top center bore ( Figure 136).
Place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore, against the bottom bar ( Figure 137).
Holding the middle bar notched end, start installation. As the bar passes the rear boss, position the shift block ( Figure 137).
As the bar passes the center boss, position the shift yoke on the bar, long hub to the housing front ( Figure 137).
Just prior to inserting the notched end of the bar in the rear boss, install the small interlock pin vertically in the neutral notch bore ( Figure 137).
Install the shift block and shift yoke lockscrews. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Lockwire securely ( Figure 138).
Place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore, against the middle bar ( Figure 138).
Holding the top bar notched end, start installation. As the bar passes the rear boss, position the shift block ( Figure 138).
As the bar passes the center boss, position the shift yoke on the bar, long hub to the housing rear ( Figure 138).
Install the shift block and shift yoke lockscrews. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Lockwire securely ( Figure 139).
If equipped, install the oil trough. Tighten the retaining bolts to 8 to 12 ft-lbs. (11 to 16 N•m) ( Figure 139).
Install the three (3) tension balls, one in each housing top bore. Install the three (3) detent springs, one over each tension ball ( Figure 140).
Make sure interlock system is working- can't shift into 2 gears at the same time.
Make sure all lockscrews are lockwired.
